Package it.unipr.sowide.actosis.util.space

Class DoublePairVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.sowide.actosis.util.space.DoublePairVector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DoublePair, DoubleVectorAPI<DoublePair>, VectorAPI<java.lang.Double,​DoublePair>, java.io.Serializable
    public class DoublePairVector
extends java.lang.Object
implements DoublePair, DoubleVectorAPI<DoublePair>
    The DoublePairVector class represents an immutable vector in a 2D continuous space. It provides some methods that manipulate its coordinates values, but their return value is always represented by a new immutable vector.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      DoublePairVector add​(DoublePair v)
      Sets the value of this vector to the sum between another vector and itself.
      DoublePairVector add​(DoublePair v, DoublePair w)
      Sets the value of this vector to the sum between another vector and itself in a 2D toroidal world.
      double distance​(DoublePair v)
      Gets the distance between the positions identifies by the current vector and by another one.
      double distance​(DoublePair v, DoublePair w)
      Gets the distance between the positions identifies by the current vector and by another one following the path crossing the border of a 2D toroidal world.
      DoublePairVector divide​(java.lang.Double s)
      Sets the value of this vector to the scalar division of itself.

      Builds the inverse vector.

      Gets the length of the current vector.

      Transforms the value of this vector to the corresponding value in a 2D toroidal world.

      Sets the value of this vector to the scalar multiplication of itself.
      DoublePairVector normalize()
      Normalizes this vector.
      DoublePairVector orthogonal1()
      Builds the orthogonal vector obtained by changing the sign of y-axis coordinate.

      Builds the orthogonal vector obtained by changing the sign of y-axis coordinate.

      Sets the value of this vector to the difference between another vector and itself.
